Module hanyaeger
Package com.github.hanyaeger.api.scenes

Class DynamicScene

java.lang.Object
com.github.hanyaeger.core.YaegerGameObject
com.github.hanyaeger.api.scenes.StaticScene
com.github.hanyaeger.api.scenes.DynamicScene
All Implemented Interfaces:
YaegerScene, Activatable, Clearable, DependencyInjector, Destroyable, Effectable, DragRepositoryAccessor, GameNode, Initializable, RootPaneProvider, com.github.hanyaeger.core.scenes.DimensionsProvider, com.github.hanyaeger.core.scenes.EntityCollectionSupplier, com.github.hanyaeger.core.scenes.EntitySpawnerListProvider, com.github.hanyaeger.core.scenes.SupplierProvider, com.github.hanyaeger.core.scenes.TileMapListProvider, TimerListProvider, Updatable, UpdateDelegator
Direct Known Subclasses:
ScrollableDynamicScene, SplashScene
public abstract class DynamicScene extends StaticScene implements UpdateDelegator, TimerListProvider, com.github.hanyaeger.core.scenes.EntitySpawnerListProvider
A DynamicScene extends a StaticScene, but adds a Game World Update (GWU). Because of this, the DynamicScene should be used in all cases where something should move on the Screen.

Because of th presence of the GWU, it is possible to add instances of Timer, by implementing the TimerContainer interface, or instances of EntitySpawner, by implementing the EntitySpawnerContainer interface.

As with the StaticScene, the viewable area of a DynamicScene is exactly the same as the area it occupies. If area should be larger, a ScrollableDynamicScene should be used.

  • Constructor Details

    • DynamicScene

      public DynamicScene()

  • Method Details

    • pause

      public void pause()
      Pause the Game World Update (GWU) of this YaegerScene. After the GWU has been paused, all Dynamic Entities and instances of EntitySpawner and Timer will no longer receive their GWA, meaning the Game comes to a pause.

      To resume the Game, call resume().

    • resume

      public void resume()
      Resume a Game that has been paused (the pause()) method has been called. After calling the method GWA will start and all Dynamic Entities and instances of EntitySpawner and Timer will again receive a Game World Update.

    • isActiveGWU

      public boolean isActiveGWU()
      Returns whether the Game World Update is active or not. By default, the GWU is active. After calling pause() this method will return false. To reactivate the GWA, use resume().
      Returns:
      a boolean value that states whether the GWA is active

    • activate

      public void activate()
      Description copied from interface: Activatable
      Lifecycle method used to perform activation of this Game Object. By default, this method is empty, so it should be implemented by the Game Object, if desired.

      Note: This method is part of the internal API, and should not be used when implementing a Yaeger game.

      Specified by:
      activate in interface Activatable
      Overrides:
      activate in class StaticScene
